sentence.text: And he 'd been more unkind than usual in this odd period of sobriety .
I was thinking more about the unkind remarks you made about my trenchcoat . "
It 's so unkind , and is such an insult to your own people .
Her parents are dead , so she lives with an unkind aunt and her children .
` God would never be so unkind , " she said with determination .
Other girls and boys can be very unkind , as Doreen had found : " All the kids kept pointing fingers , talking behind my back , starting rumours and were generally very bitchy . "
` That is very unkind of you , " said McAllister severely , but her severity was a mock .
She is , of course , very old and it would be most unkind to move her . "
` You 've been very unkind to Sarella , " began Peter .
There was an unkind expression on his face .
Three wickets in four balls seemed a pretty good response to the unkind things written about Malcolm in the press .
He says unkind things that give me pain , Harry .
We never heard anyone say an unkind word about her .
I think there were a lot of unkind words between us , and some tears .
Brian Clough had used some unkind words to describe his side on the morning of the match , but on Saturday 's evidence we beat a good side .
It would be unkind to talk of the pollsters making excuses , but they do have explanations .
It was unkind of Dorrainge to criticise and say that Medoc would be able to see them , and that Medoc would be able to tell everything they did .
Then it seemed unkind to leave Daisy out , so she was invited too .
` You 're terribly unkind about Colonel Foxton , " Christabel told her .
Oliver muttered something unkind about rats and sinking ships but Maurin missed it .
Dot thought at first she meant it was unkind for the man to be so constricted by the many instruments strapped to all parts of his body .
I used to laugh at her hair , you know , and that was extremely unkind of me .
Perhaps it was unkind of me , but I mentioned the Workers ' Education Classes .
But whatever the case , and despite the fact that she bores me to stupefaction , I ca n't be unkind to her . "
Elisabeth was grateful that the Colonel had no intention of being unkind to his wife .
Mabel never minded what anyone did , provided no one was ever unkind to an animal .
Because , while she could just about put up with the attitude of Lady Wyndham towards herself , there was no way she was prepared to let the beastly old woman be unkind to the children .
Teasing a son or daughter about size or appearance is especially unkind at this stage .

Some researchers showed , with an unkind experiment on monkeys , that in a cooperative electric-shock avoidance learning situation , the isolation-reared monkeys performed poorly in comparison to wild-born monkeys .
They were not unkind people , not mean-minded , but it would never have occurred to them to offer to help .
But she did not tell me about the food , or the cold , or the unkind teachers .
At this there was much unkind laughter , and cries of ` More , more " .
He was n't being unkind , just generous !
Will you kiss me , or will you be unkind just a little while ?
Where members of staff are unkind or even cruel to children or even other staff swift disciplinary action needs to be taken .
He was not unkind or thoughtless ; he spoke to her gently and pleasantly , but his mind was elsewhere .
I said that it would be unkind and discourteous to decline a visit , but I could not for the life of me see how I could help him where persons of much greater power were impotent .
